intro: Henriettea succosa var. guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan succulent henriettea, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
